item.ptxt: Knocking and abnormal sound due to extremely rich combustion
Abnormal sound due to friction between parts
Injector sliding malfunction
Injector stuck closed
Injector stuck open
Deposits in injector
Injector circuit malfunction
Suction control valve
Fuel pulsation sound
Air in fuel
Injector compensation codes
Fuel leakage
Intake system leakage
Intake system blockage
EGR system
Throttle valve system
Fuel pressure sensor
Manifold absolute pressure sensor
Mass air flow meter sub-assembly
Atmospheric pressure sensor (built into ECM)
Vehicle modifications
Low quality fuel
Lack of fuel
ECM

Specified values in the following troubleshooting flowchart are for reference only. Variations in the Data List values may occur depending on the measuring conditions or the vehicle's age. Do not judge the vehicle to be normal even when the Data List values indicate a standard level. There are possibly some concealed factors of the malfunction.
Check that the vehicle has not been modified in any way prior to the vehicle inspection.
This troubleshooting procedure checks for knocking and rattling.
Knocking is most likely to occur while the engine is idling.
After replacing the ECM, the new ECM needs registration (Click here ) and initialization (Click here ).
After replacing the fuel supply pump assembly, the ECM needs initialization.
Click here
After replacing an injector assembly, the ECM needs registration.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK SOUND AREA

test1.ptxt: Find the source of the abnormal sound using a mechanic's sound scope.

testgrp.testtitle: READ OUTPUT DTCS (RELATING TO ENGINE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK INJECTOR COMPENSATION CODE

atten3.ptxt: Injector compensation codes are unique, 30-digit, alphanumeric values printed on the head portion of each fuel injector. If an incorrect injector compensation code is input into the ECM, the engine may rattle or engine idling may become rough. In addition, engine failure may occur and the life of the engine may be shortened.

test1.ptxt: Check the injector compensation code.
Click here

specitem.ptxt: Compensation codes of the installed injector assemblies are the same as the compensation codes registered in the ECM.

testgrp.testtitle: TAKE SNAPSHOT DURING IDLING AND 4000 RPM (AFTER ENGINE WARMED UP)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Diesel Knocking.
Take a snapshot of the following Data List items.

item.ptxt: A snapshot can be used to compare vehicle data from the time of the malfunction to normal data and is very useful for troubleshooting. The data in the list below is that of a normal vehicle, but as the data varies between individual vehicles, this data should only be used for reference.
Check the Data List at idling and at 4000 rpm with no load after the engine is warmed up.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK SNAPSHOT (INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL #1 TO #8 AND INJECTION VOLUME)

test1.ptxt: Check Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8 and Injection Volume in the snapshot taken when the engine was idling and at 4000 rpm with no load.

entry.ptxt: Injection Feedback Val for at least one cylinder is more than +3 mm3/st
Injection Volume is less than 5.5 mm3/st at 3000 rpm

item.ptxt: When there is a problem with the operation of an fuel injector due to foreign matter in the inside of the fuel injector, etc., the fuel injection volume decreases. As a result, the ECM gives instructions to increase the fuel injection volume, which causes Injection Feedback Val to increase.

The ECM controls the system so that the sum of Injection Feedback Val for all of the cylinders is approximately 0 mm3/st. Even if the value of Injection Feedback Val for a cylinder is less than -3.0 mm3/st (-3.0 mm3/st is the lowest normal value), as long as the value of Injection Feedback Val for each of the other cylinders is 3.0 mm3/st or less, the fuel injectors are not malfunctioning.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (CHECK THE CYLINDER COMPRESSION)

atten4.ptxt: Use this Active Test to help determine whether a cylinder has compression loss or not.

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Check the Cylinder Compression / Data List / Compression / Engine Speed of Cyl #1 to #8.
Check the engine speed during the Active Test.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

entry.ptxt: The values of Engine Speed Cyl #1 to #8 are within +/-10 rpm of each other

atten4.ptxt: When cranking, if the speed of a cylinder is approximately 100 rpm more than the other cylinders, there is probably a complete loss of compression in that cylinder.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK CYLINDER COMPRESSION PRESSURE

test1.ptxt: Check the cylinder compression pressure.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When compression is low, there may be cracks in the piston or the injector may be installed improperly.

action.actiontitle: CHECK ENGINE TO DETERMINE CAUSE OF LOW COMPRESSION

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL INJECTOR OF MALFUNCTIONING CYLINDER

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injector of the malfunctioning cylinder.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the injection pipes and nozzle leakage pipe, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

testgrp.testtitle: CLEAN FUEL FILTER CASE AND REPLACE FUEL FILTER ELEMENT ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Clean the fuel filter case and replace the fuel filter element assembly.

atten4.ptxt: Be sure to clean the inside of the fuel filter case as the injector assemblies may not operate properly if the fuel filter element assembly is installed with foreign matter remaining inside the fuel filter case.

testgrp.testtitle: REGISTER INJECTOR COMPENSATION CODE AND PERFORM PILOT QUANTITY LEARNING

test1.ptxt: Register the injector compensation codes.
Click here
Perform the fuel injector pilot quantity learning.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED

test1.ptxt: Check whether the knocking has been successfully repaired.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE INJECTOR ASSEMBLIES OF ALL CYLINDERS

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel injector.
Click here

item.ptxt: When replacing the fuel injector for a cylinder, always be sure to use a new injection pipe.

Follow the procedure in the repair manual and temporarily install the injection pipes and nozzle leakage pipe, and then correctly position the injector assemblies. After that, tighten parts according to the torque specifications.
If the installation procedure is not performed correctly, injector assemblies may become out of position, which may cause the injector assemblies to deteriorate, resulting in malfunctions.
If an fuel injector deteriorates and malfunctions, other problems such as knocking, rough idle, etc. may occur.
If an fuel injector becomes out of position, it is possible that the seal between the fuel injector and injection pipe may become incomplete, resulting in a fuel leak.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK SNAPSHOT (COMMON RAIL PRESSURE AND TARGET COMMON RAIL PRESSURE)

test1.ptxt: Check Common Rail Pressure and Target Common Rail Pressure in the snapshot taken when the engine was warmed up and idling.

specitem.ptxt: Common Rail Pressure is within 5000 kPa of Target Common Rail Pressure.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM PILOT QUANTITY LEARNING (DETAIL)

test1.ptxt: Perform the pilot quantity learning (detail).
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK ENGINE KNOCKING OR RATTLING

test1.ptxt: Check engine knocking or rattling.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK THE TEMPERATURE WHEN KNOCKING OCCURS

test1.ptxt: Check the temperature when knocking trouble occurs.

entry.ptxt: Knocking occurs only in cold engine
Knocking occurs both in cold and warmed up engine

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT GLOW PLUG (RESISTANCE)

test1.ptxt: Inspect the glow plug.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: TAKE SNAPSHOT DURING IDLING (WHEN ENGINE COLD)

test1.ptxt: Make sure that the engine is cold so that the snapshot can be taken under the correct conditions.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Diesel Knocking.
Take a snapshot of the following Data List items.

atten4.ptxt: A snapshot can be used to compare vehicle data from the time of the malfunction to normal data and is very useful for troubleshooting. The data in the list below is that of a normal vehicle, but as the data varies between individual vehicles, this data should only be used for reference.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK SNAPSHOT (INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL #1 TO #8)

test1.ptxt: Check Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8 in the snapshot taken when the engine was idling.

entry.ptxt: Injection Feedback Val for at least one cylinder is more than +3 mm3/st

item.ptxt: When there is a problem with the operation of an fuel injector due to foreign matter in the inside of the fuel injector, etc., the fuel injection volume decreases. As a result, the ECM gives instructions to increase the fuel injection volume, which causes Injection Feedback Val to increase.

The ECM controls the system so that the sum of Injection Feedback Val for all of the cylinders is approximately 0 mm3/st. Even if the value of Injection Feedback Val for a cylinder is less than -3.0 mm3/st (-3.0 mm3/st is the lowest normal value), as long as the value of Injection Feedback Val for each of the other cylinders is 3.0 mm3/st or less, the fuel injector are not malfunctioning.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE FUEL SUPPLY PUMP ASSEMBLY (SUCTION CONTROL VALVE)

test1.ptxt: Replace the fuel supply pump assembly.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: If the common rail pressure becomes too high when transitioning due to problems with pre-stroke control valve operation, knocking noise worsens.
When the common rail pressure becomes excessively high as a result of a suction control valve malfunction, knocking sounds worsen.

testgrp.testtitle: BLEED AIR FROM FUEL SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Bleed the air from the fuel system.
Click here
Perform PM forced regeneration.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: When fuel lines are disconnected, air may enter the fuel lines, leading to engine starting trouble. Therefore, perform forced regeneration and bleed the air from the fuel lines.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM FUEL SUPPLY PUMP INITIALIZATION

test1.ptxt: Perform fuel supply pump initialization.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED

test1.ptxt: Check whether the knocking has been successfully repaired by starting the engine.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MAP AND ATMOSPHERE PRESSURE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAP and Atmosphere Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Compare MAP to Atmosphere Pressure when the ignition switch is ON (do not start the engine).

specitem.ptxt: Difference between MAP and Atmosphere Pressure is less than 8 kPa.

item.ptxt: If MAP and Atmosphere Pressure have the same value, both are normal. If there is a difference of 8 kPa or more, compare the values to the atmospheric pressure for that day. The sensor whose deviation is the greatest is malfunctioning.
The standard atmospheric pressure is 101 kPa. For every 100 m increase in elevation, the pressure drops by 1 kPa. This varies by weather.

entry.ptxt: MAP and Atmosphere Pressure have same value
MAP is different from actual atmospheric pressure
Atmosphere Pressure is different from actual atmospheric pressure

testgrp.testtitle: BASIC INSPECTION

test1.ptxt: Check the fuel quality.
Check the fuel for air.
Check the fuel system for blockages.
Check the air cleaner filter element sub-assembly.
Check the engine oil.
Check the engine coolant.
Check the engine idling speed and maximum engine speed.
Check the vacuum pump.
